Prologue

A Clandestine Meeting

While {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others were waging a fierce battle against {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s forces…

Here, in the land of the Beast Kingdom of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, there was an uninvited guest.

A gigantic structure known as the “Sky Castle” was currently in the process of being built at the hands of various {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|s.

When the Eastern Empire invaded the Great Jura Forest, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who had been in charge, left the construction site. Because of this, the main construction had been suspended. However, the rest of the work was still carrying on as usual with the remaining workers.

It was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| of the Three Phantom Commanders who came to such a place.

On the top floor of the Sky Castle, in the Sky Room known as a temporary office, Milim and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| were confronting one another.

The only other person present was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who was standing behind Milim. All the others had been evacuated from the area, as they would not be able to help.

Milim herself had sent {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and Frey away and was not participating in the war. There were several reasons for this, but ultimately, the most important one was the defense of her country.

When considering things from the Empire’s perspective, she could not deny the possibility that the Empire might invade through her territory.

Furthermore, if she took the initiative to join the war, that would mean laying her hands on humans, which was not her intention. So Milim chose to stay behind.

It seems that this was the right choice.

“What business do you have with me?”

Milim asked, addressing the miscreant who had come to take advantage of the opportunity.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| quietly kept an eye on the proceedings, having absolute trust in Milim. He was simply waiting for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s response to Milim’s question.

And then there was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

She removed the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| armor protecting her body and knelt down in front of Milim.

“It is a great honor to meet you, Dragon Empress Milim-sama. My name is {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. Formerly one of the Seven Original Angels , and a faithful apostle of Veldanava-sama, the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was a beautiful woman with wavy black hair like the night sky. Her eyes, which shone like the stars, were also beautiful and had a charm that could dazzle any who saw them.

Milim, who had been excited about the prospect of a fight, was set back by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s unexpected behavior.

“Huh?”

As she stood there confused, she felt {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| smiling at her.

“It is not surprising that you do not know me. When you were born, I was on a mission in the Otherworld.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| expressed to Milim that she was sorry for the delay in greeting her.

What do you mean by that? Milim wondered.

“Your strength is pretty impressive—weren’t you planning to fight me?”

“Not at all.”

“Hmm. Then, what did you come here for?”

“To say my greetings and offer some advice.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| raised her head and stared at Milim with a tense expression on her face.

The conversation resumed in the reception room, which had been temporarily set up. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| introduced herself once more and elaborated on what was currently happening.

When Milim heard that her aunt {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, had fallen into {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s hands, she wanted to run out to rescue {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| right away, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| warned her that it was too late to take any action at this point.

“What are you saying?! If this continues, my bestie {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| will—”

“It is too late now.”

At this response, Milim became furious.

“In that case, why didn’t you come here sooner?!”

“I am afraid I have no excuse for that.”

Even in the face of Milim’s furious presence, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| hung her head, offering no excuses.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s position is that of a subordinate of the “Phantom King” {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. At this moment, she was under orders to defend the Palace of {:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], false):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| , and her visit to Milim was a serious violation of orders.

Although she should have explained that, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| only felt ashamed of herself for failing to live up to Milim’s expectations. Seeing her penitent attitude, Milim had no choice but to quell her anger.

“It seems I’ve been pretty unreasonable. Thank you for letting me know.”

“Those words alone are a reward.”

As {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| continued to bow reverently, there was no sign that she was lying.

Milim is able to see through the subtleties of a person’s nature.

She judged from {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s attitude that she was acting from the heart.

“{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| is, by all appearances, a cautious person. I believe that no matter what happens, he will get through this safely. Yes, I have faith in {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.”

“Yes.”

“If you say that you’re not my enemy, then you should know that I won’t allow you to mess with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.”

“I’d like to say, “I understand,” but I’m afraid that I cannot move freely. For now, I think it would be best for us to act within {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s trust…what will you do?”

If {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| gives her an order, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| says that she will obey. However, if Milim wishes, she is prepared to defect from {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| at this time.

Her hair was as black as the night sky, and her eyes shone like the stars.

“Hmm. I can’t sense any lies in your words.”

“By your will. The whole truth, it is my heart’s desire.”

“Then I ask you, what is your purpose?”

As soon as Milim asked, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| began to speak without hesitation.

“{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| seems to be plotting the resurrection of Veldanava-sama, but I consider that act to be irreverent. Your divine father will be resurrected without any help. And the fact that he cannot be resurrected easily must be because of some reason. It is very, very difficult for one like me to discern God’s will.”

In other words, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| believes that rather than trying to revive Veldanava, Milim, his daughter, should be crowned Lord.

“You’re on my side?”

“Such arrogance is beneath my diminutive frame. I wish to be your tool. I have nothing to ask of you, and it gives me the greatest pleasure to be of service to you, so please command me.”

Everything was as Milim wills it.

That was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s intention.

Milim understood this but was puzzled by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s resolve.

“If that’s the case, then you’re willing to betray {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|?”

“Well, that is just a difference of opinion. Rather, it is {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| who is disobeying the will of Veldanava-sama.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| affirmed as such.

The tone of her voice was proof that she was serious.

“I believe that Veldanava-sama’s will is for the happiness of you, his daughter. I am convinced of this, and therefore have no compassion for those who would do you harm.”

In other words, this is a story before a betrayal.

To {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who believed that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s actions would be harmful to Milim, her colleague was nothing but an enemy.

However, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was wise.

Instead of acting on her own, she had the wisdom to leave everything to Milim. She took great care to ensure that her actions did not interfere with Milim.

That is why she risked her life to meet Milim.

She would not do anything if Milim so wished, but if she was ordered to, she would bare her fangs at anyone no matter who they were. This was the true nature of the “Three Phantom Commanders” {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

Milim was not blind to this.

“Very well. Then I will trust you and make you one of my subordinates. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, is that okay?”

“Of course, Milim-sama. I don’t think there will be any objections.”

“Okay! Then {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, you are one of us starting from today. They are not here right now, but I’ll introduce you to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and Frey once the war is over!”

“Thank you.”

“Wahahahaha! Now, with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| as the leader, I also have the ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.’ I’ll have to show off to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|!”

As soon as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| decided to join, Milim laughed heartily. She had decided to call her subordinates the ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’ in order to compete with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, which she had been secretly jealous of.

If Frey had been there at the time, the idea would definitely have been rejected. But fortunately for Milim, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was the only one present.

“I’m the leader! Well, that’s only natural. No one knows Milim-sama better than I do!”

For {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, whose number one priority was always Milim, there was no way that he could oppose her, especially if he were to be given the leadership of the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. Rather, he was overjoyed and agreed immediately.

Thus, Milim’s ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’ were established.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who was suddenly appointed as one of the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, showed no sign of being upset and accepted.

Milim’s words were the will of God.

Because of that, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| gave priority to Milim in everything.

However, a vexing problem arose here.

“Well, now then…What should we do with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|? That is the question. It’s at times like these that I wish I could consult {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|…”

“Hmm, that’s a difficult question for sure. Should we have her stay here, or should we have her remain in the enemy camp and work as a spy?”

Either way, there are pros and cons.

She really should think it over carefully, plus Milim wanted to hear from {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and Frey as well. If possible, she also wanted to consult {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

Unfortunately, Milim and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| were the only ones here.

“What about you—what do you want to do?”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was not the intellectual type, so he was not the best person to consult with. Milim, who was well aware of this, asked {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| directly instead of relying on him.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| replied without hesitation.

“As for me, I would like to return to the Palace of {:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], false):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. I haven’t manifested my body here, so if I stay, I’ll have to force myself to materialize my body. Moreover…”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s role was to deal with the cryptids in the other world. Strictly speaking, monitoring the movements of Ivarage, the World-destroying Dragon, was her primary mission.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s primary mission was to invade other dimensions, and Zalario’s was to deal with the insectars.

With the pact between Phantom King {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and “Insect Lord” {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, Zalario was now able to move freely. However, it was still difficult to communicate with Ivarage, and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s body remained bound.

“Insect Lord {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the World-destroying Dragon Ivarage? They sound strong!”

“Yes. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| is one thing, but Ivarage is very nasty. A world-destroying malevolence in itself, where coexistence is impossible. It is allowed to exist by Veldanava-sama’s will, but must still be prevented from being released from the Otherworld.”

If she stayed here, Ivarage’s surveillance would be neglected. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| wanted to make sure that Ivarage would not affect {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s plans.

“I see. Then you should keep on watching him.”

“As you wish.”

“But then, I wonder…what does {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| plan to do with Ivarage?”

“Hmm, I am wondering the same thing.”

They were unaware of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s plans, so their questions were only natural.

Then {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| disclosed all the information she knew.

“{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was given the task to monitor Ivarage by Veldanava-sama. However, he intends to abandon that mission in favor of resurrecting Veldanava-sama. We are currently expanding the Underworld Gate, and as soon as it is complete, we plan to invade this Cardinal World with all the phantoms and insectars.”

“So, the expansion of the ‘Underworld Gate’ was a long-term plan.”

“Yes.”

“But what are you going to do after that? Won’t Ivarage be released as well if you can’t close the opened gates?”

“That is a possibility, and I told {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| as much. But he didn’t care about that at all. I cannot understand what he’s thinking.”

“Huh?”

“{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| is crazy. It is safe to assume that he is willing to let the world be destroyed as long as Veldanava-sama can be resurrected.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| hated this world for taking Veldanava away from him. He intended to remake the world, leaving only those he had selected. If Ivarage destroyed the world, that may even be convenient for him.

“In other words, we’ll be the ones in trouble then, right?”

“What an annoying situation. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| seems to be troublesome, he should just be sealed up in the other world…”

Milim and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| look at each other in disgust.

They had promised to play with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others, but the war had forced them to postpone. On top of that, Milim’s mood had taken a nosedive with this new problem.

“In that case, I’ll just have to send {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| flying.”

It was an easy snap decision on Milim’s part.

“That’s right. Then Milim-sama, I, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, leader of the ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|,’ would like to receive the orders to defeat {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|!”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who lives for Milim, agrees without thinking.

“Yes! I’m counting on you, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. I’ll be heading into battle as one of the generals. We’ll crush {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s ambitions with our own hands!”

“Hahaa—yes!! I am looking forward to it so much that my arms are tingling! I’ll show you what I can do!”

With Frey out of the picture, it seemed that no one could stop these two from running amok. But then, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| spoke up.

“Please wait. I have been sharing information with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others since the start of the mission, and it seems that Emperor {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| captured {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama’s Dragon Factor. However, at the last minute, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| interfered, and the final plan was suspended.”

That was enough information to make Milim calm down.

“So {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| is safe?”

“Yes. The mission is now over, and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| is pulling back to base.”

“Hmm…In that case, it’s too soon to make our move.”

“Ah—hmm, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s right…”

With their momentum suddenly sapped, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and Milim regained their composure.

They had time to spare before {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| began his next operation. It would be better to work with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others rather than to force something at this point.

In any case, it was important share all of this information first.

Milim did not fail to understand this.

“Then {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, you will keep an eye on {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s movements until I give you an order.”

“As you wish.”

“Keep in contact with ‘Magic Communication.”’

“Understood.”

Milim and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| adjusted a special wavelength that would work only between the two of them. It would take a lot of magic to cross dimensions, but with their level of skill, it would be no problem. In this way, a means of communication was secured.

After such a series of exchanges, the meeting came to an end.

“Now then, I will take my leave.”

After saying that, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| departed.

Milim and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who were left behind, were troubled by the prospect of a new conflict.

Chapter 1

Walpurgis

The destination through {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s “portal” was a silvery world of ice and snow.

Unlike last time, it seemed that the venue was to be {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s palace.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| guided me as I stepped inside.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| followed.

Although the outside was too frigid for any living thing survive, the temperature inside of the castle was comfortable. However, half of the castle had collapsed and it was obvious that something had happened.

“Hey, so you’re here. I’m sure Milim and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| will be here soon, so make yourself comfortable and wait for them.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| told me as he led me to the room.

There were several round tea tables in a large hall that looked as if it could be used for a ball. Chairs were also placed irregularly, so that we could sit freely.

Looking at the guests, I saw that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and Leon had already arrived.

Behind {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was Pope Louis and the old butler Gunther.

I was a little relieved to see familiar faces. After a brief exchange of greetings, I took a seat. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| seemed to refrain from sitting down and waited behind me instead.

I wish they would sit down too, but I’ll let them do as they please.

And then, Ramiris made her loud appearance.

“Hey, what’s the deal with you leaving me behind?!”

Ah!

I thought we had gone together, but it seems that Ramiris was left behind.

“Wha-what? Ramiris-sama, why weren’t you with us?”

I wasn’t the only one who was caught off guard. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who had been guiding us, was flustered as well. She seemed to have assumed that Ramiris was following her and was surprised to see her getting angry.

“{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, it is unlike you to make a mistake. I received an urgent request from Ramiris-sama to pick her up.”

It was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| who said this.

Just like {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s face was battered and bruised, though her expression remained sharp.

I noticed that Ramiris had two attendants with her.

Beretta and… Hey!

“Veldora, what are you doing?”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| reacted to my words and turned to look behind Ramiris. She saw Veldora standing there and clicked her tongue, making a disgusted face.

He didn’t care that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was in a bad mood and was confidently making his point.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| looked depressed, so I comforted her for the time being.

Oh, I forgor.

“{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama is right, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama. Please call us by our names.”

“That’s right. It makes me happy to feel more familiar.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san seems to understand me very well.

There are two ways in which I address others with honorific titles.

The first is when I want to keep an eye on someone, and the second is when I want to keep my distance from them.

When I’m not close to someone, or when I should be wary of them, I think it is rude to refer to them without their honorific titles. It’s also partly because I don’t want to be disliked and partly a calculation so as not to antagonize them.

On the other hand, when I get close to someone, I naturally call them by his/her name.

There are a few people like Haruna-san or {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san, who for some reason make me want to use the “-san” honorific, but those people are exceptions.

Putting those thoughts aside…

At this time, more voices from some unexpected people were heard.

“{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, you’ve been calling me by my name too,” {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| added, “so it’s probably a little late for that.”

“That’s right,” Leon said. “You’re so brazen, I don’t think that you can fix it now.”

I was convinced that they were right.

“All right, then. In that case, I’ll just call you all by name from now on .”

I said so and accepted {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s and everyone’s offer.

She was still as noisy as ever, which was very typical of Milim.

Like Frey-san, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was also in the millions-class. He had always had the aura of a king from the start, so his irreverent attitude felt forgivable.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| responded to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| with a wry smile.

Well, one would notice. I had heard it from the reports, but after seeing him in person, I can tell that he’s become far stronger than before.

“Well, I guess I’m the same way. I was able to get rid of the shame of the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, and I guess it’s not all bad to play along with Milim’s schemes.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| laughed out loud.

“That’s right. If this is the world {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-dono wants, we wouldn’t have been able to get the souls needed to awaken. Perhaps this was your last chance?”

“That ain’t right. Is that so?”

Milim’s attitude as she shouted was, by all appearances, one of embarrassment.

‘So that’s what she was trying to do,’ I thought to myself.

But that’s beside the point.

“Um, Frey-san. You don’t have to address me by ‘-dono’ or any other honorific title.”

I was trying to make a point, but Frey-san snickered at me.

“Rejected. You are a friend of Milim-chan, our master, so you should be respected as well.”

No, no, but you call Milim so informally too.

I don’t find that very convincing…

“If that’s the case—”

“Also, you’ve been referring to me with honorifics as well. Can you stop that?”

I got caught in my own line of questioning.

Frey-san’s request was a difficult hurdle for me.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| is one thing, but I don’t feel comfortable calling out to Frey-san so casually.

How do I put it, is it the aura that I’m not good with?

Whenever I am in front of a beautiful woman, I feel debilitated .

Milim is a child, and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| is a beautiful young girl, so it’s safe. If they had been more mature, I might have had a little trouble reacting.

If the person was as disappointing as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| though, the hurdle would be instantly lowered and I would be fine.

“Ahahaha! {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, so you’re not good with adult beauties, huh?”

He saw through me?!

“That’s good. Whenever I need to ask you for something, I’ll just take the form of a beautiful woman.”

“I don’t need that kind of attention! If I know that it’s you, I won’t be happy about it!”

I was so annoyed that I lost all my tension.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was more dangerous than {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

Seriously, my subordinates are so much trouble.

In any case, no one had mentioned it, but I still noticed it.

No, everyone had definitely noticed it.

Because I knew that it would be very troublesome, I had been diverting the topic to avoid facing the reality.

Cooperative?

‘Don’t sleep-talk’ I almost muttered to myself.

“Wait, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|! Did you say that the Ultimate Dominion affects the skills of the angelic system? Oh, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| made a good point!

That’s what I was wondering as well.

Just as I was thinking that, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| stood up.

“I’ll explain it to you.”

Then {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| started talking about Skills in surprising detail. It seemed like a huge secret, a secret about the way the world worked, but he was generous enough to share it with us.

According to him,

The laws of this world were established by Veldanava, but it seems that anyone with the right administrative power can influence those laws.

Even if you don’t have that power, you can still rewrite the laws to some extent by intervening with your wish in magicules. In other words, this was the concept of magic, a kind of power.

A Skill is something that has been systematized to a certain extent so that it can influence these laws.

Skills that reside in the soul of the strong-willed and are activated by their pure energy—that is the Ultimate Skill of the angelic system created by Veldanava, and among them are the seven powers called the Virtues.

“When I fought Veldanava, he had many powers, but after the world was stabilized, he left only the strongest one, the ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|,’ and gave some of them away, releasing all that remained into the world. As a result, those powers were taken into the circle of reincarnation and appeared in the world in the form of qualified and strong souls. However, the Ultimate Skills were too strong, and were restricted to the unique level. They can be scattered among various Skills, or become a ‘Virtue’ type Unique Skill while retaining a certain amount of authority.”

I felt like the Virtue skill system was in contrast to the Deadly Sins skill system. In other words, there was the virtuous system and sinful system, or the angelic system and the demonic system.

But, well, from the way {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was talking now, it seemed like there were not seven Ultimate Skills in the Virtue system.

The ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’ I got was also an evolution from ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|,’ and it seemed to have nothing to do with ‘Virtue.’

I’m a simple guy, so I was convinced by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s explanation, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| asked a question again, as if there was nothing to hide.

“{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, if you know something, tell me. Are there seven angelic system skills in total? And what are their powers?”

Now that you mention it, I was curious about that too.

Of course, the other {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term].toLowerCase():}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|s seem to be feeling the same way.

“Huh, you’re all united like never before. All right then, I’ll tell you. First, the seven virtues of the angelic system…”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was very knowledgeable.

The seven virtuous powers that Veldanava was said to have possessed.

According to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s description—

Ultimate Skill ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’ — Its command is {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| itself, the strongest power specialized in the chain of command with a real ‘Absolute Defense’ like the ‘Castle Guard.’

Ultimate Skill ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Sariel’ — The source of life, and the power to manage the circle of reincarnation.

Ultimate Skill ‘Purity King Metatron’ — The power to sort out all mixed laws, prevent interference, and select pure energy.

Ultimate Skill ‘ {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Raguel’ — The power to provide support and amplification to others. It has been given to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

Ultimate Skill ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Gabriel’ — The power to fix the status and respond to unforeseen circumstances. It has been given to Velzard.

—That’s how it was.

To tell you the truth, I was surprised to find out more than expected.

“That is the breakdown of the skills, but only three of them are known to exist at this time. There probably would have been some changes in performance. Well, that’s lost now, so we can’t be sure.”

No one interrupted.

And so, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| continued.

“I knew that ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’ {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| who went to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had the power to dominate others, but it was more powerful than I thought.”

It was there that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| faltered.

While I waited for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| to say something, our eyes met.

Well, there was no reason to lie here.

If I could, I’d have liked to pretend that I didn’t know anything, but I can’t do that. Because I didn’t talk about the Ultimate Dominion properly in my explanation earlier, I’d give my take on it.

“Ah. I know him, or rather, I fought him just the other day. When Veldora was influenced by the enemy, I thought it was all over.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had been influenced too.

Well, the restoration is going well, but I will never accept requests from you again!”

I got swept up in the momentum and yelled out.

With this, I hope he will not ask of me any unreasonable requests for the time being.

“Hmm, you’ve been doing that sort of thing with magic for a while now. Oh well. So, what’s your conclusion?”

“I was slurring my words earlier when I said ‘’influenced,’ but I’ll rephrase it correctly. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s “Ultimate Dominion” is a heinous power of absolute control over the holders of the Angelic Ultimate Skills.”

Or rather, I still didn’t want to believe it.

That’s how it is.

I suspected as much.

On the other hand, I don’t know her that well…

I’m sure she’s dangerous, but I’m not sure how dangerous she is. I couldn’t set a threat level because I couldn’t really feel it.

“—Just asking, but could you possibly have defeated and locked her away somewhere…?”

“{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, do you really think that such a convenient story exists?”

So there wasn’t.

Leon seemed distressed as well.

“Don’t worry! There are still seven of the eight stars left here. Besides, the others are strong enough too! Let’s go on a rampage and show them what we can do!”

Why does Milim look so happy?

As I thought, there was definitely something wrong with the True Dragon’s blood.

Well, everyone all knew that the situation was the worst, but there was still some more unpleasant information to add.

“Now, to continue answering your question as to whether there are a total of seven angelic Skills, the answer is no.”

“Mmm…This is the worst.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| looked displeased.

“Well, do you know how many of the Angelic Ultimate Skills there are?”

When {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| asked, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| answered gravely.

“I don’t know all of them either. When I fought Veldanava, I couldn’t even see the bottom of it. He told me about the Seven Virtues. He also said he was going to give each of the Seven {:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], false):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Angels a special power.”

Silence enveloped the room.

In addition to the seven virtues, one for each of the seven angels, that would make a total of fourteen…

“You make it sound like he didn’t give one to all of them…”

“That’s right, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. The angels back then had weak egos, and some of them couldn’t handle an Ultimate Skill. That’s why Veldanava gave Velzard and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Gabriel’ and ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Raguel.’ It seems that he also granted skills to the eligible angels, but released the rest of the skills he didn’t transfer.”

He left himself the ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|,’ which he traded for the ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Uriel’ that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| later acquired.

It circled around and eventually became my power, and was now merged with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Cthugha.

This is not the time to be escaping from reality by mulling over the history. I feel that I have to keep it a secret for sure.

In any case, now I can see the whole picture to some extent.

“In other words, the angelic Skills are pure skills created by Veldanava, and it is possible that there were at least 14 of them. And whoever manifests and acquires them will not be able to resist {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s Ultimate Dominion, right?”

“That’s right.”

I summed it up, and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| nodded his head in agreement.

Which brought me to my next question.

“Wait, wait, wait. The angelic Skills are okay, but what about the demonic skills?”

Oh, Ramiris asked exactly what I wanted to ask.

All eyes focused on {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

“That’s a tough one to answer, but listen. I gained the Unique Skill ‘Pride’ when I was defeated by Veldanava. I had been observing him, trying to emulate his strength, and I think that’s the secret.”

“What do you mean by that?”

“Ramiris, your skills were born with you so you may not realize it, but acquiring Skill is influenced by one’s wishes. It still depends on the individual, though.”

After answering that, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| gave a brief explanation on Skills.

A Skill is normally found in the material body, the spiritual body, or the astral body. However, there are some special cases where the skill will reside in the soul itself.

Naturally, because the soul is so close to the essence of the person, the desire is greater, and it makes sense that the thing inhabiting the soul would become a powerful skill.

In addition to this, consider it in combination with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san’s view.

It is true that there was something in a Unique Skill that resided in a material body.

The Unique Skill ‘Berserker,’ for example, is easy to understand because it was inherited by Razen who took Shogo’s body.

There are various examples like that, but I agree with the opinion that the power rooted in the soul is more powerful.

It’s easy to hide, so it’s hard to be stolen, and it can also be a trump card.

In that case, the Ultimate Skill is probably a soul-level power, and I think that’s why the number of people who can handle one is limited.

But that’s not all. There are two ways to take root in the soul, not just “dwelling” but also “being engraved.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san, for example, is completely assimilated to my soul. It is impossible to separate the two, so I don’t have to worry about it being stolen. Still, I think it’s safer to keep it a secret.

This is also the case with an Ultimate Skill.

If it is only dwelling in the soul, it might be stolen, but if it is engraved, there is no need to worry about it.

However, that would be impossible to detect…

While thinking like this, I listened to everyone’s conversation.

“Which brings me to my earlier point—”

“You said that the power Veldanava unleashed was taken into the circle of reincarnation and came to reside in a strong soul.”

“Yeah, that’s right, but in my case I didn’t receive any of Veldanava’s power. I wasn’t given any special powers by Veldanava like Ramiris. It’s a power I created myself. You get it? By imitating pure power, a Skill was born. And that is—”

‘The demonic system,’ he said.

“I see. So then my ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Asmodeus’ is just an imitation, a degraded version, isn’t it?”

“No, that’s not the case. If a Skill is the result of your own will and desire, it has the same power as the original. I didn’t want to tell you this, but my ‘Pride’ has evolved into the Ultimate Skill ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Lucifer.’ That power is comparable to the angelic system, and the strength of will is what decides victory or defeat.”

“{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, it’s just like you to say that…Well, okay. Just to confirm, according to you, there are at least fourteen demonic system Ultimate Skills, right?”

“Probably. Just as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| were born from angels, demonic skills are born from angelic Skills, at least that’s what I think.”

Hmm, I guess my prediction was right.

There are too many connections in this world.

If there is a cause-and-effect relationship between hero and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term].toLowerCase():}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, it’s not surprising that there would be the same kind of relationship between Skills.

“At the very least, Veldanava’s seven virtues must have been paired with the deadly sins that evolved from the seven deadly sins.”

It seems that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Lucifer’ is paired with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Uriel.’

  • Ultimate Skill ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’ is paired with ‘Wrath King Satanael’

    • From there, here is {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s prediction.

  • Ultimate Skill ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’ is paired with ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’

  • Ultimate Skill ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Sariel’ is paired with ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Belphegor’

  • Ultimate Skill ‘ Purity King Metatron’ is paired with ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Asmodeus’

  • Ultimate Skill ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Raguel’ is paired with ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Mammon’

  • Ultimate Skill ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Gabriel’ is paired with ‘Envy King Leviathan’

He said that each of them might correspond to the other.

As for me, I was at a loss for words because I had a Skill that had already been sacrificed.

I’d be in big trouble if I made this public, but even if I didn’t say anything, I’m afraid it’ll still be a problem.

At times like these, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san was conveniently silent, so I decided to wait and see.

After {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s explanation on Skills, it was time to get back on track.

“To add on to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s explanation, it seems that angelic Skills have “control circuit” of absolute command built into them, and if you have one, you are unable resist {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s orders. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was probably turned for that reason, so don’t think of him as an ally if you meet him.”

“That’s a pain. That bastard might not be the brightest, but he’s stronger than you think.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| growls at my words.

Ignoring him, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| added in gloomily.

“What’s more troubling is that Velzard-dono is on the side of the enemy. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-dono too, perhaps?”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| also thought that this was a bigger problem.

For someone like {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, it’s better to just tell him the decision rather than to negotiate with him. I did so, remembering my past experience as a general contractor.

Specifically, I referred to the case where the general manager had successfully refused to negotiate with a JV (a construction joint venture) that was insisting on being sent more staff. While appealing that he could not afford to do so, he refused to increase the number of employees because he had already selected excellent personnel.

From the other party’s point of view, there were many situations where they had wanted to say, ‘We need more staff because your staff is incompetent!’

It was a common understanding between everyone, including myself, that there was not a fragment of sincerity in that place.

Well, it really depended on your luck whether you were really good or not.

To begin with, Chloe was absolute bed rest so I couldn’t move her. I didn’t know how Leon would react if I told him that, so I thought it best to keep quiet about it.

So, I decided to just accept the invitation.

It may not be the best time to do so considering the current situation, but it’s boring to just wait for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| to make his move. As soon as I’m ready, I’ll gradually return to my daily life.

“I knew it wasn’t like you to flounder around like this, but it turned out to be more troublesome than I expected.”

Frey-san was dumbfounded.

It’s not that she couldn’t handle it exactly, it’s just that she didn’t want to hear it.

“That’s true. Now that I’ve got the power, I’d like to see how far I can go against a True Dragon, but I doubt I’d have a chance against Velzard-dono.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| made a fearless remark, but his forehead was sweating profusely. He was probably trying to figure out what was going on and what he could even do to overcome it.

“Kuahahaha! You said it, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. Even I’ve never been able to defeat my sister. If you want to try, let me be your opponent first!”

“Master. I don’t think this is the time. If you don’t take things seriously, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| will get angry at you.”

Well, I probably should have been angry, but on the contrary, now I felt saved by Veldora’s light-hearted words. While we were talking so seriously, the situation had felt so bad that it made me depressed.

“I see. Then, in order to counter the domination, you’re going to concentrate your forces as much as possible. So, this Regalia Dominion be resisted?”

“If your will is strong enough, it can be resisted. In Veldora’s case, he was targeted when his resistance was weakened by a surprise attack.”

“Hmm. The original me would have been able to withstand it, but I was in the middle of a battle with my sister at the time. It was a little tough.”

It was tough—or rather, you were dominated.

It’s useless to try and pretend that it didn’t happen, so I wish you’d just admit it honestly.

While I was dumbfounded at Veldora, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| spoke to me.

“{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, why don’t you send Veldora to me instead? I’m not a big fan of Vio—{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, but Veldora is a familiar face, and I know him well.”

He was suggesting that we change the dispatched subordinates, but unfortunately the answer was still no.

“Sorry, I can’t do that. Veldora’s not my subordinate, he’s my friend. I can’t just decide for him.”

If he’s okay with it, then it’s none of my business. But in this situation, I can’t just ignore Veldora’s wishes and go ahead with the discussion.

That’s why I checked with him for the time being.

“Veldora, you were invited, so what will you do?”

Veldora laughed but refused.

“Kukuku. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, as much as I’d like to go and rescue you, I’m busy as well. I have a job to do, which is guarding the labyrinth of Ramiris!”

You just want to slack off…I knew it as soon as I saw Veldora declaring that he would act as usual.

It was too bad for Ramiris, who was crying out with watery eyes, but I’m absolutely sure that Veldora was just trying to take it easy.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was a lot more understanding than I thought.
