“Idiot! You think you’re so smart, shut up!”

Such was the exchange between the three of them in the empty room.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was impressed by the grandeur of the castle as she entered.

“It’s wonderful.”

“Of course it is. This castle is where Veldanava-sama resides.”

Not expecting a response, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| changed her opinion of Zalario.

It seems that he is surprisingly conversant.

While she was thinking about this, they arrived at their destination.

It was a room with two large culture tanks.

It had the appearance of a laboratory.

There were five men and five women surrounding one of the culture tanks.

Floating in the middle of them was something in the shape of a person.

Upon closer inspection, it resembled Vega.

Noticing Zalario’s presence, everyone turned around and bowed.

A man greeted them on behalf of the group.

“Zalario-sama, welcome back.”

The man’s name was Dhalis.

Strictly speaking, phantoms had no gender, but he was a confidant who had served Zalario as a man since the original cherub era.

Zalario nodded lightly and told him the matter at hand.

“The plan is cancelled.”

“Understood.”

Dhalis didn’t ask why. He believed that whatever Zalario said was right, and that they should just follow him.

This was the reason why the angelic ego was regarded as weak. That is why they were so easily influenced by the encroachment of Vega.

“I have given you a name, but it may have been meaningless.”

“I’m sorry, sir. Am I in any way at fault here?”

“No, you are not at fault. It’s just that I expected too much.”

Zalario would do his best, but he did not expect every result to be perfect. He was working to accurately evaluate the confirmed results and apply them to the future.

Therefore, no matter what the outcome, his emotions would not be shaken.

Dhalis was afraid Zalario’s disappointment.

So, despite his regrets, he followed Zalario’s words.

He ordered his subordinates, Gnome and Berne , to stop the incubator.

Nice, who is the equal of Dhalis, had no objections and had her subordinates, Bem and Sun, help her.

Incidentally, Dhalis was male and Nice was female.

The others, like Gnome, were former throne angels, so they did not have a definite gender. However, as Zalario said, they had recently acquired “names,” and their personalities had become distinctive. This had given them their individuality, but it was still developing.

It seems that one of the subordinates of the “Three Phantom Commanders” {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who was the same rank as Zalario, was possessed by a native of the invaded area and lost the initiative. It is believed that this was due to a weak ego, and as a countermeasure, only the former angelic leaders were given names.

However, several decades had passed since then, and Zalario believed that even then, the changes were so slight that no further growth could be expected.

That was why he was looking for suitable mediums for possession.

—I had thought the idea of cultivating Vega’s body was a good one, but the cells themselves were covered with evil. In that case, there is no choice but to use the undead elves that were created…

There were nine of them.

That was enough for the current leaders.

However, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was planning to ask {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| to use the ‘Army of Angels, Armageddon’ to further increase his strength. That’s what the undead elves are for.

But then, he heard the sound of shattering glass.

The culture tank had been destroyed.

“Wait! I’ll never forgive you for ripping my arm off! It’s you, I’ll get it back!!”

With the device shut down, Vega woke up and began to move.

And his target was Gnome, who had fused with Vega’s cells.

“Gubuh, gugugu—gupah…”

Before anyone could stop him, Vega’s arm grabbed Gnome. Then the fusion began, and Gnome was absorbed by Vega.

“Oh, that’s delicious! My power is getting stronger!!”

Vega was delighted.

He sensed that the Gnome guy he had absorbed had a huge amount of magicules, and that it had boosted his strength.

“Kukakakakaka! This guy is good. Now, I can take any bastard I want—Uh?!”

Vega’s climax ended the moment he locked eyes with Zalario.

“I’ve heard a lot about you. You can either join us, or you can stay here and fight.”

Vega was asked this question, but he already knew his answer.

“Heh, sorry. I got carried away. Of course, I’ll follow you.”

That kind of filthiness was quite impressive at this point.

Zalario was not dismayed, as this attitude was within expectations. He knew it, and accepted it.

The loss of Gnome was unfortunate, but it did help to strengthen Vega.

What was needed for the future battles was not an army, but individual heroes. The more powerful allies they had, the better.

Besides, Gnome had just lost his ego, so his value as a pawn had diminished. In fact, it was better for him to become Vega’s ally here.

Zalario was cruel and ruthless to his subordinates who had served him since long ago, but that was just his true nature.

The others had no problem with it as long as it was Zalario’s decision.

Vega’s outburst was forgiven, and he was treated as one of them.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who was watching the whole thing, could not help but feel disgusted.

However, if Zalario’s words were true, it meant that there would be a major deviation from the plan.

His presence was nowhere to be found, neither here at the ‘Heavenly Star Palace,’ nor in the Palace of {:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], false):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| in the Otherworld.

“It’s true. Because of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s disappearance, the plan failed. We had no choice but to retreat. I didn’t think your plan would fail, but I guess the blame lies with your ineptitude, right?”

It was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, not Zalario, who answered. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was more tactful than Zalario in that he even shifted the blame for the failure of the plan.

Zalario tacitly accepted it.

He didn’t think that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s opinion was correct, but he also didn’t think it was necessary to deny it. Zalario, who was fair-minded and strict with himself, could be flexible.

……

…

Unexpectedly, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was in a foul mood.

The first thing to do was to secure a ‘True Dragon.’

I was careless. I retrieved the skill because it was going to disappear anyway, but as a result, the “control circuit” also disappeared. I banished her to the far side of time and space so that she would not be an enemy even ifs he resurrected, but now I have increased the number of troublesome enemies…

In the event of an emergency, the insectars were able to create bodies that looked like a solidified magicules. That’s why they can enter any world.

While it would be useful to have the undead elves, it was not necessary.

In fact, that is what happened with Minaza.

She took in the materials of that world and incarnated them, and the insectoids she summoned had been confirmed to have the same properties.

Because if you have power, nothing more can be taken from you.

………

……

…

To make an {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| develop an ego is equivalent to awakening its original personality.

Even for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, the outcome was unknown. ………

…

Zalario wakes up.

He realizes that he is wrapped in the armor of flesh, and that he can wield great power in the Cardinal World.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| wakes up.

She proves the pride in her heart that her noble will cannot be defeated by anyone.

When Dhalis was about to wake up, he realized that there was another person inside him. His name was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, and he was a man of great ambition. Nice wakes up.

She became stronger at the command, but she was no different. Her strong ego is still intact.

They, Orca-{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| wake up.

With {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s knowledge as a wizard and Orca’s strength as a warrior. Both of their egos coexisted, and they were reborn as magical warriors. There was not a shred of their former self left.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| wakes up. His Unique Skill ‘Murderer’ is still intact. He has not forgotten the grudge of being killed by Damrada and has resurrected to seek greater strength.

Mai Furuki wakes up.

She cannot die because she has left her sickly brother behind, not here, but in the world beyond, in the world she was meant to live in. So she vows to return.

And so, eight people have awakened.

Only one remains.

But she is still in a deep sleep…

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was dreaming.

It was so, so long ago.

A dream from when she was still {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Kazaream?

No.

She can’t even remember her name now, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was a happy princess.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s country was founded on the site where ‘high humans’ had built a great civilization. It was a paradise for the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| race, a magical superpower that was flourishing thanks to the flowing rivers, lush forests, rich plains, and the ruins of the ancient magical empire.

But then—her father, the king, suddenly went mad.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| remembered him as a very kind and gentle man.

Even so—

One day, the king who had been praised as the king of the high elves, suddenly changed into a different person. He changed his name, and began to call himself Jahil, the Great Magician.

Her memory of what happened after that was not clear.

Jahil committed tyranny to the utmost.

He exploited his people and sought only his own glory.

He repeated his foolish experiments and created all sorts of nightmares.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was one of those who had fallen victim to this.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, a {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, was stripped of her powers.

She was killed and brought back to life as an {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

At that time, she was given an ugly appearance and the name “Kazaream.”

Her beautiful appearance was gone, and she became a cursed figure.

Rotten flesh covered her bones. It was so dry that it did not smell of decay, though perhaps that was for the best.

Few people knew the secret.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was so grieved that she began to cover herself with a mask.

“Why are you doing this to meee?!”

“Gera-gera-gera-gera! Because it’s funny. Be happy. Tens of thousands of people died to bring you back to life! Gera-gera-gera-gera!!”

It was a nightmare.

She didn’t know how her father, who was so kind, had become such a fiend. But because it was real, there was no point in lamenting.

“Father! I don’t care what you do with me. But please think of the people like you used to—”

“Shut up! Are you ridiculing me as well? My daughter is no good to me after all. I can’t afford to make the same mistake as her. I have instilled my loyalty, but you can’t be trusted! Kazaream, today you will be a man. Do you understand?”

It was an absolute command.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s words never reached ‘his’ father, Jahil, and the conversation was cut short.

She was lucky that she had not been killed—no, it was only because she had already been killed and turned into a faithful puppet that she had not been discarded to be used as a tool.

It was then that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| parted ways with her father.

Then, the nightmare continued.

The glory of the arrogant Jahil, the Great Magician, seemed to know no bounds, but the end eventually came.

The reason for this was his foolish attempt to make a puppet of the Dragon Empress Milim which incurred her wrath.

‘Soma,’ the super magic capital, fell into ruins overnight.

It was not known whether Jahil was dead or alive.

It was presumed that he was dead, as it was unlikely that he could have survived that flash of light. So {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| thought more about the people who were important to her than about the dead man.

The maidservants who had always looked after her with kindness.

The knights who followed her after she became a warrior.

Her beloved people who lived happily ever after.

Thinking of those she loved, she invoked the forbidden spell.

The forbidden spell: Dead Birthday—she had already learned the theory of the spell by becoming a test subject herself.

The spell was perfected, and Tear, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, and Clayman were born.

They were lovely, sweet children, all named by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

And in doing so, she learned a fact she did not want to know.

The undead elves created by her spell were not ugly at all. Only {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was made ugly on purpose to be so.

That hateful father, King Jahil, had taken away her beauty just to make {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| suffer.

Even if she knew that, it was already too late for her to do anything.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s appearance was the result of a curse, and there was no way to restore it.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was not alone, and the hope for survival grew within her.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| secretly made up her mind to do so.

After that, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and her friends abandoned their homeland and fled. Even though they had some regrets, they left together.

The city had perished, but it still shone beautifully in her memories. She decided that she had to cut off her regrets and use them as food for the future.

And so, she set off, and on her way, she met a man.

“What, you…If you were watching me, you could have helped me, right?”

“Don’t be stupid. Someone like me is no match for that evil dragon.”

“You’re being too modest. From my point of view, you look like trouble enough…Ouch—”

The role of the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term].toLowerCase():}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|s, led by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, was to rebuke the human race when it grew too much. It was the ability to grasp the difference in strength between you and your opponent. Facing an unbeatable opponent will only result in losing strength unnecessarily.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had a lot of things to think about.

That is who Vega is.

It had a destructive power that could overwhelm existing Skills.

It was a disaster for the world that this skill had gone to Vega, who had clue about controlling power.

No, it’s the opposite.

Be that as it may…

Vega waits.

He waits for orders to come to him.

He can only annihilate and devour those who stand before him.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was under {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s control. The spell was still in effect, even now when he had become a ‘Yōten’ (Heavenly Spirit) through the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

If he had awakened on his own, it would have been a different story, but since his evolution was a set-up, it was inevitable that the dominion would be strengthened.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who did not have the time to feel annoyed, was aware of his current situation.

Filled with incredible power, he was elated with a sense of omnipotence.

The most significant change was that his Unique Skill ‘Murderer’ had evolved into the Ultimate Enchantment ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Sandalphon.’

Of course, it had not been acquired by himself.

The ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Sandalphon’ that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| recovered from {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had been given to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. ‘Murderer’ was consumed for this purpose, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| could not resist it at will.

However, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| himself was not dissatisfied.

He was simply happy to have the power, and continued to wait for his turn.

Orca-{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was confused.

She couldn’t afford to listen to the conversations around her, and was talking to her inner voice.

Who am I? Am I {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|? Or Orca?

I don’t know. I’m {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, but I’m also Orca.

Confused as they were, they also felt their consciousnesses becoming unified.

It was not unpleasant, but rather pleasant.

I am “Orlia.”

This was the moment that the answer came to her.

Although Orlia was a newborn, she was still able to use the skills of a first-rate warrior and wizard.

Moreover, the Ultimate Enchantment ‘Alternative’ that was given to her was optimized in Orlia and transformed into the Ultimate Enchantment ‘Multiple Weapons.’

This allowed Orlia to use the experience she has accumulated in her body to create a variety of weapons. Although there was a limit to the number of weapons that could be used simultaneously, the grade was equivalent to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

Fully armed with multiple weapons, Orlia was not afraid to fight her enemies.

Mai Furuki was in despair.

She thought she was dead, but she had come back to life.

That’s good.

The problem was that Mai, even now, could not fulfill her hope of returning to Japan even though she had more power.

I’m not giving up. My Unique Skill ‘Traveler’ couldn’t do it, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-kun said there was a possibility. If a Skill is born from desire, then there must be a power that can make my wish come true.

At that moment when she thought as such with an empty heart—

The Ultimate Enchantment ‘Alternative’ given by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was consumed at the same time as the seraphim was inhabited, and Mai’s ‘Traveler’ evolved.

It became the Ultimate Enchantment ‘World Map.’

Not only can she picture any place in the world, but she can also understand what is happening in that location, which was an extraordinary power. What is even more amazing is that it was now possible to use ‘Instantaneous Movement’ to go to any place you want without any time difference.

For a person with spatial abilities, this was an unbelievable power.

And yet, Mai’s wish was not fulfilled.

The coordinates on this ‘World Map’ were only for this world.

In other words, it was impossible to cross the dimensional barrier.

Mai understood this without even trying.

It was a great despair, but either way, Mai was no longer free.

Everything was at {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s disposal.

Until the day she could be finally be free to travel to her beloved younger brother, Mai would keep her heart closed and continue to follow orders.

It is not only those who have been reborn as ‘Yōten’ who are trying to figure out what is going on.

Zalario and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| were also considering their own situations.

First of all, Zalario was grateful for the physical body he had gained. Even though he had great power, he was only able to wield it in the Otherworld. In the Cardinal World, the more power he exerted, the more energy he lost.

In order to prevent this, a body was needed, but it was difficult to prepare a vessel that could withstand the power of someone as powerful as Zalario.

Now that that problem had been solved, he would be able to show his true strength on the surface, but there was still a big problem that arose here.

Oh dear. Because of my increased power, I seem to have acquired the angelic system skill ‘Judgement King Israfil’…

Yes, that was the problem.

Zalario had acquired the Ultimate Skill ‘Judgement King Israfil’ upon his incarnation.

I can’t defy {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| with this. But if I threw it away, I would be suspected of treason.

Zalario was not so easily convinced by a will arising from a skill.

For now, he was convinced of their purpose and agreed with it, but it was unknown if that would last forever. There was no doubt that he had wanted to avoid possessing an angelic Skill, in case their paths ever diverged.

Nevertheless, the ‘Judgement King Israfil’ had been obtained.

As long as it was not the Ultimate Enchantment, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s will would not intervene. My will is my own, and I will not allow it to be rewritten without my knowledge.

Zalario was a rational thinker.

Therefore, he did not interfere in the control of the True Dragon sisters out of respect for the high success rate of the operation, even if he really disliked the operation.

And now, he was in the same position.

Really, what a mess…

Since he didn’t oppose it in the first place, his current situation was his own fault. Even so, he pondered on how to deal with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

The reason is that those who were born as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| beings already had administrative authority without having to rely on a Skill.

This is not good. If I don’t do something, they might find out that I’m disloyal.

…

She wouldn’t worry about having her mind read.

There were no other skills created by Veldanava, and the only other possibility was Ramiris’ Intrinsic Skill, ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.’

“Did you not hear what was said? Leon could become one of us.”

“Che, damn. In that case, I’ll just have to put up with the rest of them.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and Vega were talking to each other, as if they had already decided where to attack.

There was no one to stop them, and the decision was made.

There was no need to declare war, since the goal of this war was to revive Veldanava.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| decided as such.

Inevitably, the war would start with a surprise attack.

There was no need to spare any forces, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had his own ideas about that.

“The goal is to obtain the owner of the ‘Purity King Metatron.’ It would be nice if we could get rid of some of the people who interfere with that, but it would be no fun to cause damage here. Therefore, let’s leave the fools behind.”

He declared that he would attack only with the strongest.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s ‘Ultimate Dominion’ was versatile but it was not unconditionally activated. It was an absolute dominion over the angelic system, but it required him to cross his line of sight with the target.

Incidentally, the ‘Regalia Dominion’ had even more complicated conditions.

The Dominion Bullet, which had been loaned to Lieutenant {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, could only be used on a single target, and the success rate was low unless the target was caught off guard. The ‘Regalia Dominion,’ on the other hand, changed the number of people it controlled depending on the presence of the target. And most importantly was that the success rate was lower when the opponent was of the same rank as the user, meaning that they had to inflict a considerable blow or else it would fail.

At the very least, the opponent had to have a weaker presence than the user to succeed, so it was a difficult skill to use.

The current value of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s existence was about 90 million. However, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s existence value (about 2 million) was subtracted from it, so an attack on Veldora, whose existence value was over 88 million, would not succeed.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had no way of knowing that, but nevertheless, he believed that controlling Veldora would be a difficult task. That is why he needed to gather his forces before attacking Ramiris’ labyrinth.

That was also why they were trying to add the targeted person to their ranks without diminishing the strength of their own camp.

And so, the members of the sortie were decided.

“I’m staying behind.” Declared {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who was staying behind.

“What about me and my army?”

“I want you all to be ready to move your troops. We’re planning to launch a full-scale invasion following this operation.”

“Understood.”

The insectars led by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| began to prepare for war, as did the phantom army.

Zalario’s army was being coordinated by Dhalis and Nice.

Since {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s army was still deployed in the otherworldly stronghold, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was to return and hand over the control to Oma.

Then, all the remaining officers went out to battle.

If it was just the officers, Mai’s ‘Instantaneous Movement’ would take them to their destination in an instant. With {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, there would be no problem to identify the coordinates using ‘Presence Detection,’ and they could easily meet up with each other immediately using ‘Spatial Transportation.’

Based on this judgment, the surprise operation was launched.

Chapter 4

Shattered Ambition

I received the report from {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, but the contents were ridiculous.

As I expected, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had made his move.

It was within expectations, so that was good.

What surprised me was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s actions.

To my surprise, she had left {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s group with her own troops.

I was stunned by this.

“What, are you kidding me?”

“I’m serious. I was also shocked. By the way, this was something {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| didn’t know yet either. I was about to tell him.”

Hearing that, I was convinced that this guy ({:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|) was an asshole.

There were too many things going on, and this was not the time to be bothered. No, even before that, I thought he should report to his own boss before leaking the inside information to me, the enemy.

But well, you know?

It’s because {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had such a personality that I was saved, right?

For a moment, I felt a little sorry for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

But before I got too excited, I had to ask something important.

“So, where did they decide to attack?”

“Oh, it’s Leon’s territory. As I said, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| left and I’m staying behind, but all the other officers have been mobilized. Pico and Gracia are also being taken by force, so if it comes to a fight, please be merciful to them.”

“What kind of a convenient story is that?! Well, I’ll keep it in mind.”

“Please do. Oh, and I have one more favor to ask.”

“I’m busy too, so make it quick.”

I listen to what {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| has to say as I prepare to go out.

“As I thought, I really enjoyed working with Vesta-san and Ramiris, and I’m bored here. So, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san, please beat up {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and free me!”

“…”

I was speechless.

“Hey, is your head okay? That’s not something you say to an enemy, do you understand me?”

“So mean! We’re friends, aren’t we? Don’t be so cold! Oh, and by the way, did you apologize properly to Ramiris so that we could make up later?”

“Screw you! I told you to apologize to her yourself!”

“Wa—please wait, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san!”

“Moving on—”

Yes, moving on.

I can’t allow myself to be manipulated by someone against my will.

“Do your best to escape from their control as soon as possible. If you don’t do it soon, you’ll lose your title of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term].toLowerCase():}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|!”

“Hahaha, I’ll do my best. Well, I know you’re a dependable guy. There’s no one who’s as good at leaving things to others as I am, so I’ll just use you the best I can.”

That had to be a joke.

However, I also thought that it was very typical of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

“And one last piece of advice. That bastard {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| is teaming up with the Insectars.”

“I know. Seems pretty dangerous.”

“It’s not just dangerous. I had never seen that king {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| until before, but he might even be better than {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. I can’t know for sure until I actually fight him, but I know that I couldn’t beat him even if I really tried. They’re staying back this time, but we don’t know when they’ll make a move, so don’t let your guard down.”

I’d like to say that it was just extra, but it was very valuable information, and also very unpleasant.

Just by hearing that he was like {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| or above, my depression level was at its max.

And more than that, if such a dangerous guy was waiting with his army, we needed to think of a countermeasure for immediate response.

I thought about calling back {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others whom I had left in various countries, but I decided not to do that either. We would be at a disadvantage if they targeted us while we were short-handed.

If that was the case, it seemed that we would have no choice but to make do with what we had.

“Thanks for the advice. I’ll pass it on to everyone and be on the lookout. Well then, you’re going to have to work really hard.”

“Yeah. Don’t die, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.”

No need to tell me that.

This was my second life—My ‘slime life,’ and I intended to enjoy more freedom.

The war had been going on for a while now, and I was going to get rid of all the troubles and then take it easy.

And I was going to have good times with my friends, including {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, of course.

“You too.”

I replied to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, as if speaking from the heart.

As soon as I finished my conversation with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, I summoned the remaining executives to the capital city “{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.”

The location was the ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’ in the labyrinth.

When I looked at Leon’s stronghold with the ‘Argos’ surveillance magic, I saw that it was covered by a blizzard and that nothing else could be seen.

El Dorado has a mild climate. A blizzard like this was unnatural, no matter how you look at it.

It was obvious to everyone that Velzard was behind it.

There was no contact from Leon and the others, and no visual confirmation of the enemy. There must be some kind of communication jamming going on there, and we had no choice but to trust in {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s words.

Since the enemy was coming out with only their main force, we needed to assemble an appropriate force. If we tried to support them inefficiently, the damage would be too great.

If we sent out too many, the labyrinth defense would be too thin, and if we sent too few, we would not be able to achieve our goal.

It was a difficult decision to make.

“I see, the enemy is also very powerful.”

As soon as I explained what {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had told me, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| turned his attention to me.

If he was eager to go, then I was not going to stop him.

“I was planning to send just me, Ranga and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| to support them, but I guess they’re more powerful than I thought. “You don’t even have to ask. So, who else are you taking with you?”

As soon as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| announced that he was going to take me, his face broke into a smile.

“Is it me?”

“No, it’s not.”

I shut down Veldora’s comment immediately.

Just think about it. Veldora was a good ally, and a great asset, but we had to remember that he was the enemy’s target.

“You know, you should be aware that you’re being targeted. Besides, as long as you or I are safe, we can still be revived, so it’s nonsense for the two of us to go out and fight together!”

“Kuaahahaha! I was careless. Just leave the protection of the labyrinth to me!”

“Please do.”

I was in a serious pinch right now, so I was really counting on him.

Once the most problematic child was convinced, I turned to Zegion.

“Zegion, and Apito, continue guarding the labyrinth. We can’t leave this place empty because it seems like there is a dangerous enemy waiting for us.”

“Leave it to me. I wish you the best of luck, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama.”

How very reliable.

The dragon lords would remain as a force, and we’d be able to analyze their strength.

That left {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san, Beretta, and Charys.

“Charys, keep an eye on Veldora to make sure he doesn’t go out of control.”

“I don’t need to be told, sir. I’ll keep a close eye on Veldora-sama so that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama can go into battle without worry.”

“Eh? I’m being monitored?”

“Don’t worry about it.”

“No, no, I’m curious.”

“Read this and calm down.”

Charys handed Veldora a comic book to quiet him down, and I found it reassuring in a different sense.

“Just leave Master to us, we’ll take care of him!”

“The labyrinth is well guarded, and we are training so that we will not be caught unaware this time. I am looking forward to showing you the results.”

I’d rather not have that chance, but it was reassuring to know we were prepared for anything. I nodded back to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san, asking for her help.

“{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama has given me strength, and I am stronger than ever. Please rest assured.”

Well, I believe you.

Whether they can beat {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| or not, the current Beretta team should be able to keep up with them.

That was why—

“I’m taking Kumara with me.”

Me, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, Ranga, Kumara, and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| were chosen as the members of this sortie.

However, there was still one thing that was bothering me…

“Sorry, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. I made the decision without asking your opinion, but if you don’t like it, you can turn it down. Did you want to stay and protect your wives?”

Momiji and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| were very pregnant.

Apparently, the gestation period of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| varied widely. Momiji’s mother, Kaede, had been carrying Momiji in her belly for over three hundred years.

In the case of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, some had embryos and some had eggs, even though they were the same species. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was said to be have an embryo, but she also maintained her transformed state throughout her pregnancy.

It may be that the human figure was more overworking, but it seemed that there were also individual differences. Well, it’s not like I knew about out the whole biology of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| yet, so there was no point in worrying about it.

Let’s hope that some ecologists who were interested in the subject would solve it within a reasonable range.

I left it at that.

What is important now was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s feelings of leaving his two pregnant wives to go to the battlefield.

‘Which is more important, work or me?’

I think that this was one question that everyone hated to be asked.

Well, I had been a bachelor, so I never had to deal with that question.

I didn’t regret it—I’m not jealous, okay?

I was such a corporate slave that I couldn’t even come home from work on my birthday, so I think it would have been bad if I had a girlfriend.

Emotionally, the wife took priority, but rationally, it might be the job. If one didn’t have money, they couldn’t make a living, so one would have no choice but to give priority to their work.

However, that is difficult because there are times when a man has no choice but to protect his family.

There is no doubt that it was ideal to work for an understanding company.

Anyway, as a policy of our country, I wanted to pursue this ideal as much as possible. As for me personally, I didn’t want {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| to have a marital crisis, and I wanted to respect his will.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| replied, as if laughing at my concern.

“That is an unnecessary concern. I will do everything in my power to protect the people I love. In the first place, I wanted to have an heir so that they could take my place in case something happened to me. If you misunderstand that, I’m not doing the right thing.”

Well, that may be true in theory.

But is that really okay with him?

“But, you know…”

Strange as it may seem, I was the one who was lost.

As if to reassure me, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| smiled.

“Don’t worry. The safest place on earth is here, and I’ve asked {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| to guard them. If something should happen, he’ll take over for me and raise my successor. So, there’s nothing to worry about! He said it so refreshingly.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| nodded his head in agreement, and looking around at the faces of the others, they all seemed to feel the same way. It made me wonder if I was the one who was wrong.

“Hohoho. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama is very kind. The fact that he didn’t call {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| “young” showed how serious he was about his statement. “That’s right. There is no way that my husband can lose!”

“Yes, I agree with Momiji-san. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama, if you leave us and die, we’ll chase you to the ends of the earth. Please be prepared.”

It seemed that these two were already prepared.

If that’s the case, there was no time for me to be confused.

“Okay, I appreciate the sentiment. I’m not saying we’ll win, but I promise that we’ll all make it back alive.”

“Hmm, just leave it to me, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama. All we have to do is win.”

I forgot to mention that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was an incredibly confident person. When he and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| were together, it seemed like they could defeat any opponent.

The same was true for Kumara and Ranga.

“Yes, sir. I will do my best too, and we won’t be defeated.”

“My lord, I am with you! No matter who the enemy is, there is no doubt if it’s you!”

There seemed to be some kind of a mistake, but I understood what they were trying to say.

“You’re right. This is no time to feel lost, and there’s no use worrying about it before the fight. Although the goal is to defend Leon, let’s do our best to crush {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s ambitions!”

I declared as such.

Speaking calmly with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and coming to some beautiful understanding—I wasn’t going to pretend that we’d be able to do something like that.

He’s dangerous.

He has no humanity, and he’s willing to sacrifice anything to achieve his goal.

It was annoying, but in the end, I had no choice but to pick a fight with someone who was outside the line of mutual respect.

“Let’s go!”

Everyone nodded at my words.

Do not worry about anything until after everything is over.

I made up my mind to do so and began to ‘Teleport’ everyone to the battlefield.

By the time {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others had begun their preparations, the war had already begun.

There was no declaration of war, and Vega began going out of control.

“Damn it, can’t he at least try to follow the plan?”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| nodded in agreement when she heard {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| complaining.

The purpose of this operation was not to destroy El Dorado, but to bring the angelic Skill owners before {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and add them to their ranks.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was confused when she heard that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s “control” could be handled by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. However, she believed that it was tactically correct to keep the generals out of the battlefield.

So, without any doubts, she accepted the current plan.

The plan was simple.

Everyone here, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, Velzard, Zalario, Pico, Gracia, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, Tear, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, Vega, Orlia, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, and Mai Furuki, thirteen in all, would go on a rampage.

The idea was to slaughter those who rushed out to intercept them, while searching for the angelic Skill users.

Although it was a guess, and not a definite one, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was sure that it was Leon. Even if she was wrong there would be no problem. The mission would be over as soon as the target was taken.

If they didn’t come out to defend the city, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and her team were going to go in as an assault team.

However, as soon as they had arrived at the site through Mai’s ‘Instantaneous Movement,’ Vega went berserk, ignoring all instructions. He struck at the city’s defense barriers and destroyed them. He then charged straight into the place that appeared to be the royal castle.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was dumbfounded.

He’s even dumber than before now that he’s got more power. We can’t incorporate him into our operations at this rate, we might as well seriously consider a purge.

Violation of orders was strictly forbidden in any organization.

Moreover, if it was an executive who did it, it might eventually become a matter of not being able to control the military discipline. To make an example of the subordinates, they might have to think about how to handle Vega.

Anyway, the operation had already started.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| decided to discuss the plan with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, leaving Vega to be dealt with upon their return.

“Myself and Velzard would be a perfect diversion, but Zalario, Pico and Gracia, should stay here. I’ll put the rest under your command, so you can run wild and find the people you want.”

Tear and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, not to mention {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, Orlia, Mai, and the rest of the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| resurrection team, were under the influence of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s spell. The orders were not compulsory, but they were connected by ‘telekinesis.’

“Vega will be reprimanded for his outburst later, but for now, hit the enemy with all your might. If you can’t win, I’ll allow you to retreat, so go ahead and go wild!”

With the exception of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, all of them there had gained a great deal of power. They at least had more self-control than Vega, but were still eager to see how strong they had become.

That’s why, as soon as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| gave the go-ahead, they all started moving at once.

And {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, alone, followed behind.

I have free will and have been given a certain amount of authority. I might not get any more opportunities in the future.

Perhaps she should wait for a better time. Such a thought crossed her mind, but she was terrified that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was in control of her will.

It was not unlikely that this was her last chance. Optimism was a dangerous thing, and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| decided to take action.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| were crazy.

That’s right.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had sworn that she would never betray her friends.

Even if that meant accepting {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s control.

And she was prepared to repay the favor she had received from {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, no matter how dirty her hands would become.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s control seems to be absolute within a certain range. “Can you hear me, Laplace?”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| called upon her most reliable trump card.

On the other hand, Leon’s subordinates immediately became tense.

They had been training for what was to one day come.

Today, it was the real deal.

Leon nodded in agreement.

“…That’s not good.”

Using ‘Spatial Transportation’ required the exact coordinates of the current location and the travel destination. If they had been cut off, it was safe to assume that the enemy had taken such spatial measures into account.

“If the ‘magic transfer circle’ is destroyed, then the arrival of reinforcements will be delayed even more.”

It was the deployment of their reserve forces.

The maintenance of the city defense barriers was left to the Yellow Knights, who specialized in defense, and the White Knights, who specialized in recovery. The offensive Red Knights were dispatched to intercept the enemy.

The only remaining force was the Blue Knights who specialized in raiding. Depending on the situation, they would cover the weak points.

Alrose took charge as Leon gave out commands.

Yes, it was a good fight.

Misora’s face is distorted with pain.

“Gahhahaha! Weak, weak you’re too weak!!—No!! I’m too strong. I’m just too strong. Sorry to say, but you’re too weak to even think about eating, so you’ll be suffering for a long time. You must hate your weakness!!”

The fact that Oxian was good at auxiliary magic was also significant. His physical strength and the durability of his sword were compensated for by the multiple layers of Kahn’s and Oxian’s magic.

Even so, the chances of victory were almost zero. Oxian, a nihilistic nobleman, did not want to win against an opponent who would not be injured by a direct hit. He was conscious of the fact that his sword would not be broken, and was trying to make this battle last as long as possible.

He did not want the enemy to reach his beloved Leon.

The daunting battle had only just begun.

The Red Knight Fran and the Yellow Knight Kizona, the commanders of the Red and Yellow Knights, respectively, were fighting against Orlia.

Fran was a healthy, auburn-skinned beauty, lightly armed and focused on offensive power. Kizona was small in stature but cheerful in disposition, and wore heavy full-body armor.

Fortunately for these two women, Orlia had a lack of fighting spirit.

Orlia was cautious.

Unlike Vega and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, she was cautious about her skill.

However, Fran and Orlia were the worst match-up. All of her magic had fallen before Orlia’s shield.

She gave {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| a bastard sword, and Mai a crescent bow. With this, she could test both her offensive and defensive capabilities.

It can be said that those two were saved by Orlia’s character.

With the two of them as his test subjects, Orlia was slowly and surely getting used to the weapons she had created with her Ultimate Enchantment.

Mai was on the battlefield, but she couldn’t get rid of the feeling of being out of place.

She didn’t understand the point of fighting.

But it was impossible to go against {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

If she had seriously participated in the battle, the situation would have turned in favor of the angels long ago.

But that didn’t happen.

“If things continue like this, everyone will be unhappy. But what am I supposed to do? Tell me, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-kun…”

She still needed some time before she could make a move.

“I’ll deal with her.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s words were met with no objections from anyone.

He had fought Velzard several times before, both long ago and recently, and she was clearly very strong. Inevitably, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| would have to be the one to face Velzard.

Besides, the current Velzard wasn’t holding back her power. The evidence was that she had changed from a girl to a grown woman.

And her eyes were not the usual deep-sea blue diamond hues, but were golden. They shone with a mysterious, evil, and shining light.

That was Velzard’s true form, her human battle form. Seeing this, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| realized that she was serious.

“I love, love, love you, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. So—you should also kill (love) me more and more and more!!”

She then challenged {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| with a big smile on her face.

“Che, that’s why I said these things were troublesome!”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was also fighting back seriously.

It would be suicide to go easy on Velzard.

And so, in the skies above the castle, a battle broke out between the strongest forces in the world.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was strong.

His existence value was so high that it almost reached 40 million.

But Velzard was different.

Velzard was more than twice as powerful as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and had unimaginable power. She was not just the sister of the Creator, she was the most absolute on earth.

And Velzard had never been serious, even when dealing with her sister, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. She always responded in the form of a girl, that is to say, with her own power blocked.

Even when she wiped out Veldora, she had only dealt a playful blow. This meant that her attacks were very energy efficient.

The only time she got serious was when she took on {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

The only reason {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was able to fight her on even terms was because of his superior combat ability. On top of that, he always tried his best to keep the ground as unaffected as possible, so one could understand how terrifying a man like {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Crimson was.

The battle, as always, lead to a stalemate.

And then {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| realized.

This person wasn’t being controlled after all.

No, she was being controlled, but it seemed to be the result of not daring to resist, because it was in line with Velzard’s wishes.

Velzard seemed to be very happy.

It was a very familiar look that could only be seen in the midst of battle.

Rather than good news, this was a disappointing fact.

A long-repressed desire that had been suppressed for so many years, only to be unleashed because of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others. That means that this relationship would not improve until Velzard was convinced.

If she was only being controlled, it would have been enough to release it. But since she wasn’t, there was nothing {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| could do.

“Good grief, man!”

While complaining about this, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| fearlessly sneered.

And then he happily intercepted Velzard.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| avoided a fight with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was a troublesome {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. Knowing this well, he hesitated to deal with him.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| left the castle without saying a word.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| thought about interfering, but Zalario would not allow it.

Zalario, though reluctant, was confident.

He had just been incarnated, but his body was in good condition. It had been a long time since he had exerted himself to the fullest, but he wouldn’t be broken down, and that lifted Zalario’s spirits.

“Dark Eight Palms.”

Zalario took the initiative.

It was a very simple technique that involved putting magical energy into the palm of one’s hand, but its power was immeasurable. Eight separate energy projectiles were flying towards {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, on the other hand, muttered in a bored tone.

When you are dealing with a lower-ranked opponent, or even a competitor, you have to be very careful about what you do.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| lightly evaded the projectiles and glared at Zalario.

This was a fact.

When did we even fight?

Leon sat on his throne.

The time of peace was over.

With a loud bang, the front door was broken down.

The great door leading to the audience room shattered into pieces, scattering debris like dust.

And out of that dust, the intruder proudly emerged.

“Hoohohoho. Good day, everyone! My name is {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| the “Angry Pierrot” of the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. Pleasure to make your acquaintance!”

With his fat body and angry clown face, he exuded a certain air of strangeness.

Leon had met this clown once before.

He was now in remembrance of his own stupidity, a business partner with whom he had made a contract.

He had felt a certain power when he met him before, but now it felt nothing like that.

He felt an uncanny power.

What bothered him, though, was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s true purpose.

If he had wanted to capture Leon, it would be reckless for him to come alone.

As I thought, the enemy’s forces must have outnumbered ours. But I don’t understand. What is he thinking? If he goes and helps the others, he would have the power to change the course of the war…

As he pondered this, Leon left his seat.

“You come here alone and think you’re going to make it out alive?”

Alrose shouts.

Claude keeps his hand on his sword, ready to protect Leon at any moment.

Leon thinks.

This {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| must have some other purpose, or—

“Ah, there you are, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Leon. Do you remember me?”

It was a beautiful woman with a graceful appearance.

She was dressed in a navy-blue suit, like what a secretary would wear.

Her skin was white and delicate, and her blond hair was tied up in a chignon that suited her well-toned face.

Her eyes, indigo with a mysterious glow, were fixed on Leon.

“Since I’ve changed my appearance, it’s probably more accurate to say it’s nice to meet you. I am {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.
