“Gera-gera-gera-gera! I’ve been waiting for this day. Finally, I can use this power to the fullest!”

Jahil laughed evilly.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s huge body was engulfed in flames, and he became a fire emperor who destroyed anything he touched. Jahil, who could control fire at will, unleashed his vicious power.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s “angry mask” shattered and melted.

And the face that appeared was ugly and distorted, as if representing his heart.

“{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|—give me back my {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|!!” {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| shouted.

But her sorrowful voice only pleased Jahil.

“Gera-gera-gera-gera! You’re so weak. I’d like to give you a good beating, but it’s just too bad! I’m under {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-dono’s orders to kill. Forgive me, you fool.”

With that, Jahil hurled a fireball at {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

While not as powerful as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s, Jahil’s fire was still powerful. If exposed to its heat, any material would burn up in an instant.

“Damn it, don’t ignore me!”

Laplace tried to deflect the fireball with a magic bullet, but it was far too powerful. It was swallowed by the fireball and had no effect on it. The fireball then swelled up and swallowed {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, Tear, and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

But as the flames subsided, a figure remained standing.

“It’s useless.”

It was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

Despite his fatal condition, he stood up and blocked the fireball with his ‘Anti-Skill.’

“…Hoh? My flames won’t penetrate. So that’s it. It’s not a matter of power. It’s nasty. Let’s just admit it’s a real pain in the ass.”

Jahil’s eyes lit up with the light of a researcher.

His mouth twisted with pleasure, as if he were curious about a new toy.

“Boss, are you okay?”

“No, of course not. I’d like to go lie down in bed quickly, but the problem is that the enemy doesn’t seem to want to let me go.”

“Well then…What are you going to do?”

“The important thing is—”

The important was to survive.

He understood that, but couldn’t think of a way to do so.

According to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s observations, Jahil’s power was ten times greater than Laplace’s. Compared to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| himself, it was certain that his power was five times greater.

………

……

…

In fact, from a divine point of view, Laplace had an existence value of a little over a million. That strength was unparalleled compared to a {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term].toLowerCase():}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| seed, but as an awakened {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term].toLowerCase():}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, it was at the bottom of the group. It was Laplace’s experience that allowed him to make full use of his skill and make him so powerful.

In comparison, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who was still a Saint and so high up that it would not be surprising if he became a “divine spirit,” had an existence value of about 2 million. However, he possessed the powerful Skill ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Mammon’ and the foul ‘Anti-Skill’ that disabled other Skills, so he had a combat ability that could not be measured by numbers.

Tear had an existence value of 2.4 million, which was higher than {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s if one was only looking at the numbers. She had a Unique Skill called ‘Optimist’ which allowed her to have less desire for herself. Under certain conditions, she could raise all of her physical abilities threefold, but this would only work against lower-ranked opponents.

Since she did not have the same level of skill as Laplace, she was the weakest of the four.

And {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was the one with the largest existence value among them.

She was the most powerful among the four, with an existence value of nearly 3 million. In addition to that, she was reinforced with the Ruin Scepter, so her total existence value reached 4 million.

Sadly, however, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was a support-type. She was not that good at neither close combat or long-range combat. It was not that she was of no use, but she was not very promising in terms of combat.

In comparison, Jahil’s existence value reached 14 million.

This was the result of adding Jahil’s power to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s power. And Jahil enjoyed not only magical combat but also close combat for the purpose of taunting the weak.

He could take them all down with pure violence alone if he so wished.

It was, without a doubt, the worst possible situation.

………

……

…

Despite being a genius, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was frustrated with himself for not being able to come up with an answer that could get him through this situation.

He wondered if he should have continued pretending to be insane for a while longer, but rejected the idea. That was one way to go, but the best time to get {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| back had been at that moment.

It was just that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was a step ahead of him.

He had prepared carefully and had taken all possible precautions. The more moves one had hidden, the more advantages they would have.

This time, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| honestly regretted that he had lost.

Even though he had been with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| for a long time, he had not realized that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who was supposed to be his friend, had any evil intent. Rather than saying that it was his fault for not being able to see it, he should have praised {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| for making such careful preparations.

It’s always like this. This world is really so unreasonable…

While reflecting on his actions, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| lamented the absurdity of this world.

There was a possibility that Tear might have had something to do with it, and he tried to be wary of it, but soon realized that it was meaningless.

If there really was such a thing, there was no reason to keep it in mind at this time.

Suddenly, he remembered that slime, which seemed to be the embodiment of unreasonableness.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san. If it’s that man, then he would never give up. I’m the one who came here first, but he came later and did whatever he wanted. And that’s even better than the ideals I’ve been trying so hard to achieve, it’s really sickening.

That’s what he thought, but he wasn’t displeased.

Rather, it seemed to make him laugh from the bottom of his heart.

“What are you laughing at?”

“No, I’m just remembering something amusing. I thought you were a truly nasty and dangerous opponent, but there is someone who is even scarier than that. He’s the only one who can easily overcome my tricks and still remain aloof.”

“Wahaha, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san, huh? Well, that guy really is something else.”

“Right? It’s not my nature to rely on others, but I’m willing to do so here. He’ll be here soon to support us, so there’s only one option to choose.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| smiled fearlessly.

“Yeah, that’s true.”

Laplace also laughed.

“Buying time. That was the only way from the start, so it’s a decision that’s a little late coming.”

As if caught up in the moment, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| stood up as well.

“Alright, I’ll do my best too!”

Tear was also motivated.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, Laplace, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, and Tear.

The four of them stood shoulder to shoulder, facing Jahil, who had taken over {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

“I’ll avenge you, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.”

With Laplace’s spirited words as a signal, the fierce battle began.

Silvia, while fighting Leon, observed {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others from a broader perspective.

They were outnumbered four to one, but it was Jahil who actually had the upper hand.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was half-dead and half-alive.

The hole in his chest seemed to have been filled, but it had worn him down.

Fortunately, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s constitution was a special one called ‘Anti-Skill,’ This stopped Jahil’s fireball, and the fight to the death has been barely maintained.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was the key defender, and Laplace and Tear were his guards. With {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| providing support, they were able to stand up to their formidable opponent (Jahil).

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-kun, right? If he falls, then the whole thing will collapse…

It wouldn’t just be a loss of their defenses. The mood of the entire party was made by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s cheerful instructions.

In response, Laplace pushed himself harder.

Tear was just a drifter, so she could be strong or weak depending on the mood.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, the command tower, seemed to understand the situation—

Well, even if she understands, she can’t do anything if she doesn’t have help…

In other words, there was nothing they could do.

They were slowly losing strength, and it was now a game of how much time they could postpone until they were defeated.

Stalling.

The answer they came up with was probably the only correct one.

“Damn, that’s really bullshit strength. My ‘Anti-Skill’ can ignore all the ‘defensive barriers,’ but his pure durability is too high to do any damage…”

“You’re right, his nature is just too different. Even with my prediction, I can’t see a future where I can do any damage.”

No matter what they did, they knew it wouldn’t work, and it made them feel hopeless.

But there was only one reason why this was not the case.

They believed that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others would soon arrive.

As El-chan said, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-kun sure is amazing. Even when he’s not here, he is still a hope for everyone.

Silvia was also hoping for the best.

“Even for you Master, don’t you think you’re being a bit too lax, looking the other way when dealing with me?”

“Perhaps so. But in a battle of similar powers, the one who is impatient will lose!”

Silvia evaded Leon’s divine speed slashes with a flick. They were both owners of the same line of Skills, and of the same school of thought. They knew exactly what the other was doing.

The same was true for Leon, but he was under orders from {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| to defeat the enemy. There was a clear difference between those who could just take their time and those who had to defeat their opponents, and this difference affected the course of the battle.

And there was another reason.

It was Leon’s deep psychology.

Subconsciously, Leon was struggling to regain his free will. It was only a minor effect, but it was definitely slowing down his body.

That was why the battle between Silvia and Leon was very stable, with Silvia in the lead.

That’s what Silvia thought.

Even so, why isn’t {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| making a move? I’d really be in a bit of trouble if he joined in here.

On the other hand, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others would be defeated by the imbalance at once.

Why hadn’t that happened?

Silvia turned her gaze to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| to find out why.

She observed and made an inference.

He doesn’t seem to be in a hurry. It like he thinks that Leon-kun and Jahil are nothing but pawns. He’s going to take our data here and make sure to kill us next time.

Silvia was disgusted by the answer.

He was being overly cautious.

Normally, one would think that it would be more reliable to kill the enemy here. The reason {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| didn’t was because he was putting his own safety first. That led her to believe that he had more than Leon and Jahil in his clutches.

That was true.

Based on her observations, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| believed that he could destroy the enemy with the forces he did not bring this time.

He refrained from making a move here, considering the possibility that the enemy might be hiding some secret technique. This cowardly and morbid cautiousness was the essence of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

At any rate, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s decision to stay out of the way seemed to accomplish their goal of stalling. But just when Silvia was feeling a little more relaxed about the situation, something happened.

“Oh, yes, I remember now. That ‘Anti-Skill’ was a trait that the Dragon Princess’ pet once had. As I recall, it was a very troublesome constitution that blocked magic and skills, but there are established ways to deal with it. It’s easy. If it’s pure power that is neither magic nor skill, it can’t be repelled!!”

Jahil may be evil, but he was also a top researcher. As a {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| of the Ancestor, he had a proven track record, and his eyes were very reliable.

That’s why he saw through the correct answer.

The ‘Anti-Skill’ had also been passed down to Milim’s pet Chaos Dragon at the end it’s life, but Milim’s power had defeated and succeeded in sealing it.

Jahil, who was unaware of this example, changed his attack method without hesitation, as if he was confident in his answer.

In other words, simple violence.

Using his own body as a weapon, he attacked {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

“Gera-gera-gera-gera! You’re too weak!”

Jahil smiled broadly and beat {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| to a pulp.

From that point on, it was completely one-sided.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| barely managed to fight back with his physical skills, but the difference in strength was insurmountable. It didn’t take long for the three of them to fall to the floor together, as Laplace and Tear were lightly dealt with.

“Jahil—!!”

In a fit of rage, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| activated a spell, but it was blocked by the fighting spirit surrounding Jahil’s body. Then, Jahil’s fist plunged into {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s stomach. It was a pure difference in power that decided the outcome in a brutal way.

“Gera-gera-gera-gera! Do you understand the folly of challenging me? So, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-dono, are you sure you want to get rid of them?”

Jahil asked for the final confirmation.

He may have intended to kill them from the start, but at least he was making his boss look good.

“Do as you please.” {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| replied succinctly.

Hearing this, Jahil laughed evilly.

“Kazaream, my son. It’s a shame. You were a good test subject. But rest assured, I will soon have a new toy to replace you right away!!”

Jahil declared and began to squeeze power between his outstretched hands. Then, the pure fighting spirit swirled and condensed, transforming into a vast amount of energy that could distort even space-time.

The atmosphere crackled and burned.

This was neither magic nor skill, but pure destructive power. Not only was it enough to destroy {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, but it was so powerful that it might even damage Jahil himself.

Silvia looked at it sideways and paled, thinking that this was no good.

All the power was concentrated in one point, creating a destructive force that went beyond nuclear magic. If she took the hit seriously, she’d probably end up disappearing without even leaving her body.

Realizing that this was truly dangerous, she put up a ‘defensive barrier’ with all her might. Leon must have also made the same decision, because he stopped his attack on Silvia and went to defend {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was trying to defend himself with ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Mammon,’but he seemed to be running out of energy. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s ‘Barrier’ with the Unique Skill ‘Schemer’ was the only last resort.

Although she had lost the ‘Domination King Melchizedek’ to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had once reached her ultimate level. Therefore, her skill, ‘Schemer,’ was unique but had grown to a level of performance comparable to an ultimate skill.

But it was not enough.

In order overturn the overwhelming difference in power, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| alone was inadequate.

I can’t do it with just this. I can’t withstand it…

That was Silvia’s intuition.

Jahil’s attack was two-tiered. The energy of pure destruction was wrapped up in the ‘Blaze King Agni.’ After {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s ‘Barrier’ was blown away by the fireball, the real attack would be waiting.

This was all because of Jahil’s absurd amount of magicules. It was an inconceivably dense mass of energy, several times denser than Silvia’s. Even if the current Silvia had joined in with the others, it would still be impossible to prevent this attack.

Wasn’t there anyone else who could prevent this?

Thinking so, she looked around at the four frozen people.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was doing her best, but to no avail, and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was running out of steam, as mentioned previously.

So, what about the other two?

Tear didn’t have an Ultimate Skill, and her ‘defensive barrier’ was probably not enough to stop anything.

In that case, there was no choice but to hope for Laplace, the last one.

With that in mind, Silvia turned her gaze to Laplace and saw something surprising.

Eh? That face—No way, that person is—

Underneath Laplace’s shattered mask, there it was.

It was a very familiar face.

She thought she had long forgotten it, but just one look was enough to fill her with memories.

Silvia couldn’t help shouting involuntarily.

“Run, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|!!”

But it was too late for that advice—

“Well, goodbye. I’ll break your soul into pieces and wipe you off the face of the earth!”

Jahil’s words signaled the end.

True to his words, he caused a great deal of destruction.

There was a flash, and then an explosion.

Leon’s castle was blown to bits.

A great ball of fire raged wildly, spreading heat waves and flames as it disappeared—

Epilogue

The End of the Dream

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| laughed in despair.

Oh, dear. I tried my best, but is this as far as I go?

It’s had been a little over ten years since he came to this world.

It started with the encounter with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Kazaream, and he had been striving to achieve my wishes ever since.

He had made friends with whom he could share his heart, and together, they had shared many hardships.

However, rapid growth also came with its own setbacks. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s continued success was an anomaly.

It was inevitable that the plan would collapse when he failed to see the change in Clayman. For {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, this had become a guilty feeling.

There were a few other things on his mind, and so he decided to finally greet everyone with a thought-accelerated ‘Telepathy Net.’

“Sorry, guys. I didn’t do a very good job, so I’m sorry for the mess I’ve gotten you into.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| apologized, but no one blamed him for it.

“It’s not just the boss’ fault. Rather, I think my failure was a bigger factor.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| also felt a great deal of guilt.

If {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| hadn’t been so obsessed with Leon in the first place, the current situation wouldn’t have happened. However, if {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| hadn’t been obsessed with Leon, she might not have met {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, so it wasn’t all that bad.

As if to comfort {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, Tear also spoke up.

“Don’t cry, Princess. I remembered a few things, too. I don’t know your name or anything, and it’s like a mixture of memories and feelings, but I was the princess’s maidservant. And you know, it’s the king who was to blame! The maids were all on the princess’ side. So don’t you regret it, okay princess? I’m only happy if I can accompany you to the end!”

Even if it ended here, Tear had no regrets.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| saved her life that had already ended, and gave her a new purpose in life. If she could die with her, Tear would be happy.

“Tear, you…”

“Ahaha, that was fun! {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and Clayman loved the princess. So, we were grateful to the boss. I like her as the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Kazaream because she was strong and handsome, but after all, the princess was the best looking!”

“Well, that’s true. At first, I laughed because I thought it didn’t suit her, but now I’m more comfortable with it. If that’s what you’re supposed to look like, then I guess it’s natural.”

Even Laplace agreed. Then, he spoke with a laugh.

“So, boss. Don’t worry about it. We did the best we could. I have no regrets. Clayman will be waiting for us in the afterlife, so let’s live happily there!”

He did everything he could.

Bad things and good things.

As a man who walked the middle lane, he lived his life without shame.

That’s why Laplace was so proud of himself and his friends.

“Wahaha, it’s the last time, so you can complain more, right?”

“I have no complaints.”

“Mmm-hmm! Yeah!”

“Well, we all believed the boss. If we can’t do it with the boss, then we’ll just give up.”

Still, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| insisted.

“Laplace, are you sure you want to come with us? I heard someone calling your name. If you’re on your own, shouldn’t you be able to get out in time?”

Silvia turned to Laplace and called out “{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.” At which point, Laplace—

“I see. So my real name was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.”

He remembered a lost memory.

He turned to Silvia and was relieved to see that his beloved wife was safe.

But that was all.

He was already dead.

It had been more than 2,000 since he had been born as Laplace.

How could he go home now?

Besides, the most important thing for Laplace now was his friends, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others.

That’s why Laplace replied with a joke.

“No problem. I am Laplace. I am the vice chairman of the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, and the “Wonder Pierrot” Laplace. Well, it’s a little late for that now, so don’t worry about it, boss.”

“…Is that so?”

“Sure. Besides, you can’t just leave me out of this at the last minute!”

Hearing this, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| also felt warmth in his heart.

Although the world had been unreasonable, his life had not been so bad.

In that case, he decided to fight with all his might until the last moment.

“You’re all idiots. But I don’t hate it.”

“Don’t let the boss tell us that!”

“That’s true. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama is smart, but sometimes he acts like an idiot. That’s exactly what he did this time.”

“Ahaha! But, you know, it’s kind of fun when to work together in the end!”

Facing the threat of Jahil, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others’ hearts were united.

When you’re with your friends, even if it’s hell, you can still enjoy it.

So there was no need to be afraid.

“Then, farewell. I’ll break your soul into pieces and wipe you off the face of the earth!”

Even after hearing Jahil’s death sentence, the smiles on {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and his friends’ faces did not disappear.

Immediately afterwards, a flash of light brought everything to nothing.

Playtime was over.

The ambitions of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and his friends had now reached the end of their time.

Afterword

It’s been a long time, everyone.

The anime series is now airing, so there may be some newcomers!

I’m happy if that’s the case.

So, this is the 18th volume of the series. I’ve entered the final chapter as planned, but I’m beginning to think that it will be difficult to finish this in the remaining three volumes.

My plan was to continue with the embryonic phase, the clash phase, and the conclusion phase, but the content of this story is almost like the feeling of the embryonic phase.

There is no one to blame for this.

It’s not anyone’s fault, because I told you beforehand that there was a possibility that the story would be changed depending on my mood!

Well, excuses are hard to come by these days.

Anyway, just the fact that the war has started in this volume is a good thing.

I don’t want to talk too much about the contents of this volume, because it would spoil the story, but the setting of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san turned out like this.

She changed a lot from her original image, but this was all due to the fact that she looked so cute as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

Actually, I had been thinking of making her a character of an unknown gender from the beginning, but the moment that the character design was released, everything was decided.

It reconfirmed to me that the power of illustration is very important.

By the way, there are some discrepancies with the explanation in volume 13.5, but I hope you can understand that it’s a usual thing.

I wonder when it I’ll learn that it’s bad to not boil down the settings unless it is necessary.

Really, I’ll be careful next time…though it’s a little too late to reflect on that now that we’re entering the last phase…

Well, that’s about it for volume 18, so what did you think?

I wrote it with the intention of making my readers happy, so if you enjoyed it, then there is no better joy than that.

If you enjoyed it, please continue to support my work, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. With your encouragement, I will do my best to expand the world of Tensura in the future.

See you soon.
